# Project Assets Checklist

Use this checklist to track which assets have been recovered and added to the repository.

## Pitch Deck
- [ ] Final presentation PDF/PPTX uploaded
- [ ] Slides reviewed and finalized
- [ ] Any speaker notes documented

## Design Assets
- [ ] Complete wireframes added to `/prototype/wireframes/`
- [ ] Screenshots added to `/prototype/screenshots/`
- [ ] Design files (Figma/Sketch/XD) linked or exported
- [ ] User flow diagrams included
- [ ] Branding assets (logo, colors, typography) documented

## Demo Materials
- [ ] Prototype demo video recorded and linked
- [ ] Interactive prototype link added (if applicable)
- [ ] Demo script or walkthrough notes included

## Photography
- [ ] Team photo added to `/team/team-photo.png`
- [ ] Event photos collected
- [ ] Award ceremony photos (if available)
- [ ] Behind-the-scenes photos

## Documentation
- [ ] Customer discovery notes completed
- [ ] Interview transcripts or summaries added
- [ ] Survey data included (if applicable)
- [ ] Competitor research expanded
- [ ] Problem space analysis refined with data

## Team Information
- [ ] All team member profiles completed in `/team/roles.md`
- [ ] Contact information updated (LinkedIn, GitHub, etc.)
- [ ] Individual contributions documented
- [ ] Mentor acknowledgments added

## Research Materials
- [ ] Academic citations added
- [ ] Market research data included
- [ ] User personas finalized
- [ ] Quantitative validation data

## Technical Assets
- [ ] Code repository linked (if applicable)
- [ ] Technical architecture documented
- [ ] API documentation (if relevant)
- [ ] Development roadmap outlined

## Business Documentation
- [ ] Business model canvas
- [ ] Financial projections (if created)
- [ ] Go-to-market strategy notes
- [ ] Partnership opportunities documented

## Next Steps
- [ ] Post-hackathon developments documented
- [ ] Future roadmap outlined
- [ ] Open issues/TODOs identified
- [ ] Contribution guidelines reviewed

---

**Last Updated:** December 2024

**How to Use This Checklist:**
1. Check off items as they're added to the repository
2. Update the last updated date when making changes
3. Add notes below about what's still needed

## Notes & Priorities

### High Priority:
- [Add specific high-priority missing items]

### Medium Priority:
- [Add medium-priority items]

### Low Priority / Nice-to-Have:
- [Add lower-priority items]

### Permanently Missing:
- [Document items that are likely unrecoverable]

---

*This checklist helps track reconstruction progress and ensures nothing important is forgotten.*
